description: A global war that originated in Europe and lasted from 1914 to 1918, involving many of the world's great powers.

sub_events.name: Assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand
sub_events.description: The heir to the Austro-Hungarian throne was assassinated in Sarajevo by Gavrilo Princip, sparking the war.

sub_events.name: Austria-Hungary declares war on Serbia
sub_events.description: Triggered by the assassination, Austria-Hungary declared war on Serbia.

sub_events.name: Battle of the Somme
sub_events.description: One of the bloodiest battles in WWI with over one million casualties.

event_name: The Fall of the Berlin Wall
description: The Berlin Wall, a symbol of the Cold War, was brought down, marking the beginning of the end of Soviet influence in Eastern Europe.
factors: Relaxation of border restrictions by Hungary
East German migration to the West

sub_events.name: Pan-European Picnic
sub_events.description: Hungary temporarily opened its border with Austria, allowing hundreds of East Germans to flee.

sub_events.name: Mass protests in Leipzig
sub_events.description: Peaceful Monday demonstrations grew rapidly, pressuring the East German government.

sub_events.name: Opening of Berlin Wall
sub_events.description: Following political turmoil, border crossings were opened, and crowds began dismantling the wall.
